content.rendered:
Photo by tookapic

Hey all, This Week in Genesis is stuffed with so much going on I don’t think I can adequately introduce it in a couple of sentences, but it’s safe to say there’s new themes (including the updated Genesis Sample theme from StudioPress I’m very excited about), new plugins, and BobWP and Carrie Dils!

What more could you want…

Themes

First up this week, the new and updated Genesis Sample theme is here with a whole lot of new changes. Used a lot by developers -including me – as the starting point for new projects (or to create their own starter theme from), the list of updates reads:

  • Added accessibile mobile menu
  • Added accessibility support for the 404 Page
  • Added the custom header option to upload your own logo
  • Added customizer option for primary color
  • Added HTML5 support for gallery and captions
  • Optimized Avatars for Retina Display
  • Added the After Entry Widget Area
  • Repositioned the secondary navigation menu to the footer
  • Added theme defaults
  • Added Landing Page template
  • Added image size
  • Set localization
  • Updated XML file

I’d definitely encourage you to check out the StudioPress announcement post for full details though.

Our free starter theme, Genesis Sample, has a fresh new look: https://t.co/AvonETnZTU #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/xm8A2Tm88C

— Lauren Mancke (@laurenmancke) May 18, 2016

Next up, I’m a big fan of his work over at WP Studio and Frank’s latest and greatest theme – Plastic Pro – doesn’t disappoint either.

Meet Plastic Pro, A new Genesis theme with a masonry layout and infinite scroll. https://t.co/toboLevIWG #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/ZSFgUvzRNB

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) May 19, 2016

Showcase

As ever you lot never disappoint me with the showcase and this week starts with a great site for Courtney Kirkland’s sweetsouthernmedia.com (h/t StudioPress).

Love the fresh design @CourtneyKirklnd’s Sweet Southern Media website —> https://t.co/QJ5LdFOKDL #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/XUzB6juZaV

— StudioPress (@studiopress) May 18, 2016

Plus, Nicola Tweed for katemartens.co.za

Newly revamped @kate_martens based on the Thatcher & Thorne theme https://t.co/V89xazXpWi #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/UNyVIGYgqi

— Nicola Tweed (@nicolatweed) May 18, 2016

Shaan Nicol for fox8.tv

Forgot the URL https://t.co/cSSBZUAHSU #genesiswp https://t.co/yFQbMhW6jc

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) May 16, 2016

Clayton Collie for vernerbrumley.com

Website Launch for Family Law Firm

Stephanie Hellwig for thehairanswer.com (based on Web Savvy Marketing’s Lisa Marie theme)

Just launched a new site using @WebSavvyMrkting Lisa Marie #wordpress theme https://t.co/fE0NqzQ4et #genesiswp

— Stephanie Hellwig (@stephanehellwig) May 19, 2016

Tony Brennan for popejohnpauliiaward.com

Recently built https://t.co/sMc9PwPn1S by @Octoberstone on @studiopress Altitude Pro on #genesisWP pic.twitter.com/e7ZvMoMOAR

— Tony Brennan (@BrennanTony) May 14, 2016

…and another site for fairshare.org.uk

Checkout https://t.co/yElgX9YIon by @Octoberstone made with @studiopress AgentPress Pro on #genesisWP pic.twitter.com/vUmKapK9J9

— Tony Brennan (@BrennanTony) May 14, 2016

Cyndia Papa for thewhammybars.com (based on the Sunshine theme from SimpleProThemes).

Launched another new #genesiswp website with customized Sunshine theme from @SimpleProThemes! https://t.co/Xrul5MS8ks

— Cyndi Papia (@OfficeToGo) May 16, 2016

Podcasts

Great to see BobWP on OfficeHours.fm with Carrie this week. If you don’t know Bob (and I think most of you do) he consistently puts out great content not just about WordPress in general, but Genesis specifically.

Miss today's episode with @bobwp? Catch the replay here -> https://t.co/oRqJ7vmAh1 pic.twitter.com/ISIz1y6VFt

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) May 20, 2016

Best of the Rest

Remkus de Vries with some news on the work going on over at translate.studiopress.com

Migrated https://t.co/KEVXIfTFHZ from GlotPress stand-alone to a WordPress + GlotPress plugin version. Go forth and contribute to #genesiswp

— Remkus de Vries (@DeFries) May 18, 2016

Remkus also posted a new plugin, ThemeMix Pro for Genesis which promises to add – page templates, plugin compatibility and a Featured Content Widget with BuddyPress integration to the Genesis Framework – to the GenesisWP.guide homepage (if weekly updates aren’t enough for you you can keep an eye on that 😉

ThemeMix Pro for Genesis

Another new plugin posted to the site this week is Blox Lite (h/t Fran Eleazer) who says – I have tried so many different plugins to add custom headers to the top of the page, and none of them did exactly what I wanted, but THIS. Might be worth a look then!

Blox lite

The folks over at Rainmaker Digital have released a new course over on their Digital Academy Website focused on How to Create Profitable WordPress Themes, Plugins, and More. I’m not a member of their Digital Commerce Academy so I haven’t seen it, but I imagine it might be interesting to a few of you on here.

How to Create Profitable WordPress Themes, Plugins, and More — https://t.co/PSQcu9lwmB

— StudioPress (@studiopress) May 18, 2016

It’s also great to see Rainmaker Digital (via StudioPress) supporting the work of Tonya over at Know The Code. StudioPress joins Ninja Forms, ServerPress and SiteGround as sponsoring partners and it’s great to see companies from all across the WordPress space supporting what Tonya is doing.

A BIG thank you to @studiopress who is now our corporate partner & are helping me level up #WordPress & #GenesisWP developers.

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) May 17, 2016

Tonya also has a new (free) tutorial on her 4 Steps to Problem Solving when coding.

My 4 Steps to Problem Solving + Introducing a new series of problem solving labs https://t.co/m0erOJHjpK #wordpress #genesiswp

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) May 19, 2016

And Sridhar has a nice (free) tutorial covering setting up a Flexbox Grid in Genesis.

Flexbox Grid in #GenesisWP:https://t.co/yPreO3HNld pic.twitter.com/FrEf65FcnN

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) May 17, 2016

Lauren Gaige has a nice tutorial on How to Integrate Convert Kit with the Genesis eNews Plugin

How to Integrate @ConvertKit with Genesis — https://t.co/sREK1foYUo #genesiswp via @restored316

— StudioPress (@studiopress) May 17, 2016

Neil Gee on how to Create a Middle Header Widget Area for a Genesis Child Theme

Create Middle Header Widget Area for Genesis Child Theme https://t.co/DxHadK4Hyr #GenesisWP

— Marcy Diaz (@mjsdiaz1) May 16, 2016

Anita has an update on her Genesis Signature Widget Plugin.

Update! New Genesis Signature Widget Plugin Adds Your Signature to Your Blog Posts! https://t.co/ga07bioTUl #genesiswp #wordpress #bloggers

— Cre8tiveDiva (@TheCre8tiveDiva) May 18, 2016

That’s all for this week.

If I missed your awesome thing though, please just post it up on the homepage and you’ll be sure to catch my attention and the many other Genesis fans.

PS If you’re not already a subscriber, I’d love it if you subscribed for email updates below. I send out one (occasionally two) emails a week and only about Genesis.

excerpt.rendered: This week is stuffed with new themes (including the updated Genesis Sample theme from StudioPress I’m very excited about), new plugins, and BobWP and Carrie Dils!
